result.markdown:
--- title: "Quarto Cheatsheet" format: html categories: [quarto] toc: true toc-depth: 2 toc-location: left editor: source editor_options: chunk_output_type: inline --- ## Markdown Basics ###### Formatted text: *italics* **bold** *asdf* some *blue* text `verbatim code` inline math: $E = mc^{2}$ [link to Quarto](https://quarto.org) Bullet List - unordered list - sub-item 1 - sub-item 2 - sub-sub-item 1 - unordered list - sub-item 1 - sub-item 2 - sub-sub-item 1 Numberbed list (4-space indent seems preferable) 1. asdf 2. asdf2 i) asdf ii) sdf 3. asdf 3 ::: callout-note Callouts: note that there are five types of callouts, including: `note`, `tip`, `warning`, `caution`, and `important`. ::: ###### Mermaid plot: ```{mermaid} flowchart LR A[Hard edge] --> B(Round edge) B --> C{Decision} C --> D[Result one] C --> E[Result two] ``` ##### Picture ![](unnamed.jpg){width="255"} Here is a footnote reference,[^1] and another.[^2] You can also reference inline![^3] [^1]: Here is the footnote. [^2]: Here's one with multiple blocks. Subsequent paragraphs are indented to show that they belong to the previous footnote. { some.code } [^3]: Hello. I am an inline footnote. The whole paragraph can be indented, or just the first line. In this way, multi-paragraph footnotes work like multi-paragraph list items. ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ## Running R Code ###### Code with output: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggplot2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.2.2 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} d <- diamonds head(d) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 Ã— 10 carat cut color clarity depth table price x y z 1 0.23 Ideal E SI2 61.5 55 326 3.95 3.98 2.43 2 0.21 Premium E SI1 59.8 61 326 3.89 3.84 2.31 3 0.23 Good E VS1 56.9 65 327 4.05 4.07 2.31 4 0.29 Premium I VS2 62.4 58 334 4.2 4.23 2.63 5 0.31 Good J SI2 63.3 58 335 4.34 4.35 2.75 6 0.24 Very Good J VVS2 62.8 57 336 3.94 3.96 2.48 ``` ::: ::: ###### Load R packages silently (nothing shown below): ###### Un-evaluated code: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sqrt(-2) ``` ::: ###### Folded code, with tidy-ing of code: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} r_fibonacci <- function(n) { if (n <= 1) { return(n) } else { return(r_fibonacci(n - 1) + r_fibonacci(n - 2)) } } r_fibonacci(10) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 55 ``` ::: ::: ###### Plot with options: ::: {.cell layout-align="left"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(d, aes(x = carat, y = price, color = cut)) + geom_point() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Diamond plot](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){fig-align='left' fig-scap='caption' width=384} ::: ::: ## Running Python ###### Python code ::: {.cell} ```{.python .cell-code} import os,sys,time def py_fibonacci(n): if n <= 1: return n else: return(py_fibonacci(n-1) + py_fibonacci(n-2)) py_fibonacci(10) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 55 ``` ::: ::: ###### Going back and forth between R and Python: R: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data <- mtcars %>% select(mpg, cyl, disp) head(data, 3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` mpg cyl disp Mazda RX4 21.0 6 160 Mazda RX4 Wag 21.0 6 160 Datsun 710 22.8 4 108 ``` ::: ::: Python: ::: {.cell} ```{.python .cell-code} r.data = r.data.assign(km_per_liter=lambda x: x.mpg / 2.352) r.data.head(3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` mpg cyl disp km_per_liter Mazda RX4 21.0 6.0 160.0 8.928571 Mazda RX4 Wag 21.0 6.0 160.0 8.928571 Datsun 710 22.8 4.0 108.0 9.693878 ``` ::: ::: Back to R: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data <- data %>% mutate(mpg_converted = km_per_liter * 2.352) head(data,3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` mpg cyl disp km_per_liter mpg_converted Mazda RX4 21.0 6 160 8.928571 21.0 Mazda RX4 Wag 21.0 6 160 8.928571 21.0 Datsun 710 22.8 4 108 9.693878 22.8 ``` ::: ::: ###### R code inline: The column names in `data` are: mpg, cyl, disp, km_per_liter, mpg_converted ## Tables ###### Simple markdown table: | Right | Left | Default | Center | |------:|:-----|---------|:------:| | 12 | 12 | 12 | 12 | | 123 | 123 | 123 | 123 | | 1 | 1 | 1 | 1 | ###### Kable output ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} knitr::kable(head(mtcars,3)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} | | mpg| cyl| disp| hp| drat| wt| qsec| vs| am| gear| carb| |:-------------|----:|---:|----:|---:|----:|-----:|-----:|--:|--:|----:|----:| |Mazda RX4 | 21.0| 6| 160| 110| 3.90| 2.620| 16.46| 0| 1| 4| 4| |Mazda RX4 Wag | 21.0| 6| 160| 110| 3.90| 2.875| 17.02| 0| 1| 4| 4| |Datsun 710 | 22.8| 4| 108| 93| 3.85| 2.320| 18.61| 1| 1| 4| 1| ::: ::: ###### Datatable output ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} DT::datatable(head(mtcars,3)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} g <- ggplot(mtcars,aes(x=mpg,y=disp)) + geom_point() g ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ###### Code blocks and output ## Layouts ###### Two outputs, side-by-side (simple) ::: {.cell layout-ncol="2" tbl-cap='Two tables' tbl-subcap='["mtcars","Just cars"]'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(knitr) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: package 'knitr' was built under R version 4.2.2 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # table on the left kable(head(mtcars[, 1:3])) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} | | mpg| cyl| disp| |:-----------------|----:|---:|----:| |Mazda RX4 | 21.0| 6| 160| |Mazda RX4 Wag | 21.0| 6| 160| |Datsun 710 | 22.8| 4| 108| |Hornet 4 Drive | 21.4| 6| 258| |Hornet Sportabout | 18.7| 8| 360| |Valiant | 18.1| 6| 225| ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # table on the right kable(head(cars,3)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} | speed| dist| |-----:|----:| | 4| 2| | 4| 10| | 7| 4| ::: ::: ###### margin plot: ::: {.cell .column-margin} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggplot2) mtcars2 <- mtcars mtcars2$am <- factor( mtcars$am, labels = c('automatic', 'manual') ) ggplot(mtcars2, aes(hp, mpg, color = am)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(formula = y ~ x, method = "loess") + theme(legend.position = 'bottom') ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![MPG vs horsepower, colored by transmission.](index_files/figure-html/fig-mtcars-1.png){#fig-mtcars width=672} ::: ::: ###### Aside: Quarto uses the concept of columns to describe page layout (e.g. the "body" column, the "margin" column, etc.). Here is some text. [This is a span that has the class aside which places it in the margin without a footnote number.]{.aside} Below we'll describe how to arrange content into these columns. All of the layout capabilities described in this document work for HTML output and many work for PDF and LaTeX output. For details about the PDF / LaTeX output, see PDF/LaTeX Layout. ###### Column margin ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} head(mtcars) ``` ::: ::: column-margin We know from *the first fundamental theorem of calculus* that for $x$ in $[a, b]$: $$\frac{d}{dx}\left( \int_{a}^{x} f(u)\,du\right)=f(x).$$ ::: ###### Tabset: ::: panel-tabset ## Code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} head(mtcars) ``` ::: ## Output ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs am gear carb Mazda RX4 21.0 6 160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46 0 1 4 4 Mazda RX4 Wag 21.0 6 160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02 0 1 4 4 Datsun 710 22.8 4 108 93 3.85 2.320 18.61 1 1 4 1 Hornet 4 Drive 21.4 6 258 110 3.08 3.215 19.44 1 0 3 1 Hornet Sportabout 18.7 8 360 175 3.15 3.440 17.02 0 0 3 2 Valiant 18.1 6 225 105 2.76 3.460 20.22 1 0 3 1 ``` ::: ::: ::: ###### Figure layout with fenced divs: ::: {layout-ncol="2"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: ###### Figure layout ::: {layout="[[70,30],[100]]"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs am gear carb Mazda RX4 21.0 6 160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46 0 1 4 4 Mazda RX4 Wag 21.0 6 160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02 0 1 4 4 Datsun 710 22.8 4 108 93 3.85 2.320 18.61 1 1 4 1 Hornet 4 Drive 21.4 6 258 110 3.08 3.215 19.44 1 0 3 1 Hornet Sportabout 18.7 8 360 175 3.15 3.440 17.02 0 0 3 2 Valiant 18.1 6 225 105 2.76 3.460 20.22 1 0 3 1 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: :::
